description: Bitten by a radioactive spider, high school student Peter Parker gained the speed, strength and powers of a spider. Adopting the name Spider-Man, Peter hoped to start a career using his new abilities. Taught that with great power comes great responsibility, Spidey has vowed to use his powers to help people.
name: Spider-Man

description: Wounded, captured and forced to build a weapon by his enemies, billionaire industrialist Tony Stark instead created an advanced suit of armor to save his life and escape captivity. Now with a new outlook on life, Tony uses his money and intelligence to make the world a safer, better place as Iron Man.
name: Iron Man

description: Caught in a gamma bomb explosion while trying to save the life of a teenager, Dr. Bruce Banner was transformed into the incredibly powerful creature called the Hulk. An all too often misunderstood hero, the angrier the Hulk gets, the stronger the Hulk gets.
name: Hulk

description: As the Norse God of thunder and lightning, Thor wields one of the greatest weapons ever made, the enchanted hammer Mjolnir. While others have described Thor as an over-muscled, oafish imbecile, he's quite smart and compassionate.  He's self-assured, and he would never, ever stop fighting for a worthwhile cause.
name: Thor

description: Abandoned by his mother, Matt Murdock was raised by his father, boxer "Battling Jack" Murdock, in Hell's Kitchen. Realizing that rules were needed to prevent people from behaving badly, young Matt decided to study law; however, when he saved a man from an oncoming truck, it spilled a radioactive cargo that rendered Matt blind while enhancing his remaining senses. Under the harsh tutelage of blind martial arts master Stick, Matt mastered his heightened senses and became a formidable fighter.
name: Daredevil

description: The Human Torch is a fictional superhero appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Human Torch

description: Cyclops is a fictional superhero appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics and is a founding member of the X-Men.
name: Cyclops

description: Beast (Henry Philip "Hank" McCoy) is a fictional superhero appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics and is a founding member of the X-Men.
name: Beast

description: When Zenn-La was threatened by the world-devouring entity known as Galactus, Norrin Radd stood up for his home planet and offered to work for Galactus, finding him new planets to eat, in exchange for saving his own. Years later, the Surfer has protected Earth and many other planets, becoming one of the greatest heroes in the universe.
name: Silver Surfer

description: The Invisible Woman (Susan "Sue" Storm Richards), previously known as the Invisible Girl, is a fictional superheroine appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Invisible Woman

description: The radiation that mutated Reed Richards, Sue Storm and Johnny Storm into superhuman beings had also mutated Ben Grimm, transforming him into a grotesque, rock-hided strongman dubbed the Thing.
name: Thing

description: The Black Panther (T'Challa) is a fictional superhero that appears in publications by Marvel Comics.
name: Black Panther

description: Iceman (Robert "Bobby" Drake) is a fictional superhero appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics and is a founding member of the X-Men.
name: Iceman

description: The Two-Gun Kid is the name of two Western fictional characters in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Two-Gun Kid

description: Seriously wounded, young lawyer Jennifer Walters was given a blood transfusion by her cousin Bruce Banner. Usually in better control of her powers and temper than the Hulk, She-Hulk has been a high profile New York lawyer as well as an upstanding member of both the Avengers and Fantastic Four.
name: She-Hulk

description: The metal monstrosity called Ultron created the synthetic humanoid known as the Vision from the remains of the original android Human Torch of the 1940s to serve as a vehicle of vengeance against the Avengers.
name: Vision

description: Dr. Henry "Hank" Pym is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Hank Pym

description: The Scarlet Witch (Wanda Maximoff) is a fictional superhero appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Scarlet Witch
secretIdentities: Wanda Maximoff <!-- As Wanda's species varies so much in comics
it makes most sense to leave this field out and let the lead explain her history.  Wiki articles about fictional characters are not biographies

description: Professor Charles Francis Xavier (also known as Professor X) is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics and is the founder and leader of the X-Men.
name: Professor X

description: Colonel Nicholas Joseph "Nick" Fury is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Nick Fury

aliases: White King  of the Hellfire Club
description: Magneto is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics, commonly in association with the X-Men.
name: Magneto

description: When Janet Van Dyne's father died, she convinced her father's associate Hank Pym to give her a supply of "Pym particles"; Pym also subjected her to a procedure which granted her the ability to, upon shrinking, grow wings and fire blasts of energy, which she called her "wasp's stings."
name: Wasp

description: Hawkeye (Clint Barton) is a fictional superhero appearing in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Hawkeye

description: Simon Williams agreed to undergo an experiment to give him superhuman powers, and Baron Zemo gave him the costumed guise of Wonder Man, warning Simon that he would die without further treatments from Zemo in order to ensure his loyalty, but Simon betrayed Zemo to the Avengers and ultimately joined their ranks.
name: Wonder Man

description: Quicksilver (Pietro Maximoff) is a fictional superhero appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Quicksilver

description: Loki is a fictional character that appears in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Loki

description: Doctor Victor Von Doom is a fictional supervillain that appears in publications by Marvel Comics.
name: Doctor Doom

description: Juggernaut (Cain Marko) is a fictional supervillain appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Juggernaut

aliases: The Prince of Power; The Lion of Olympus
The Prince of Power; The Lion of Olympus; Harry Cleese; Victor Tegler
description: Hercules is a fictional superhero appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Hercules

description: Norman Osborn is a fictional supervillain that appears in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Norman Osborn

description: Adam Warlock is an artificially created human who was born in a cocoon at a scientific complex called The Beehive.
name: Adam Warlock
secretIdentities: originally Him; changed to Adam Warlock

description: Sif was born a second generation goddess of Asgard and eventually became Thor's lover.
name: Sif

description: With a mental connection to all birds and a suit that gives him wings to fly, The Falcon has been both the partner to Captain America and an Avenger himself. Whether as a super hero or in his secret identity of social worker Sam Wilson, The Falcon dedicates his life to standing up for others.
name: Falcon

aliases: The hunger that does not cease
description: Galactus is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Galactus

description: The Kingpin (real name Wilson Fisk) is a fictional supervillain appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Kingpin

description: Sir Percy of Scandia, also known as the original Black Knight, is a fictional character in the Marvel Universe.
name: Black Knight (Sir Percy)

description: Marvel Boy is the name of several fictional comic book characters in comic books published by Marvel Comics, including predecessor companies Timely Comics and Atlas Comics.
name: Marvel Boy

description: Marvel Boy (Robert Grayson), also known as The Uranian, is a fictional character, a superhero in the Marvel Comics Universe, one of several to use the name "Marvel Boy".
name: Marvel Boy (Robert Grayson)

description: The Man-Thing (Dr. Theodore "Ted" Sallis) is a fictional monster appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Man-Thing

description: Doctor Octopus (real name Dr. Otto Gunther Octavius), also known as Doc Ock, Doc Octopus, and the Superior Spider-Man, is a fictional supervillain appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Doctor Octopus

description: Crystal (Crystalia Amaquelin) is a fictional superhero appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Crystal

description: Medusa is a fictional character, a superhero that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Medusa

description: Electro (Maxwell "Max" Dillon) is a fictional supervillain that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Electro

description: Black Bolt (Blackagar Boltagon) is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Black Bolt

description: The Lizard (a.k.a.
name: Lizard

description: The Blob (Frederick J. "Fred" Dukes) is a Marvel Comics supervillain, an adversary of the X-Men.
name: Blob

description: Flash Thompson was the high school bully of Peter Parker while also being one of Spider-Man's biggest fans. After losing his legs during military service, he became the new Venom, working as an operative of the United States government.
name: Venom (Flash Thompson)

description: Harold "Harry" Osborn is a fictional anti hero in the Marvel Comics Universe.
name: Harry Osborn

description: Mephisto is a fictional character that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Mephisto

description: Adrian Toomes is a former electronics engineer who employs a special harness of his own design that allows him to fly and endows him with enhanced strength.
name: Vulture

description: Mysterio is a fictional supervillain and enemy of Spider-Man that appears in the Marvel Universe.
name: Mysterio

description: Gorgon is a fictional character that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Gorgon (Inhuman)

description: Karnak is a fictional superhero published by Marvel Comics.
name: Karnak

description: Jean Grey, or Jean Grey-Summers, is a fictional superhero appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics and is a founding member of the X-Men.
name: Jean Grey

description: The Mandarin is a fictional supervillain that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Mandarin

description: The Absorbing Man (Carl "Crusher" Creel) is a fictional supervillain that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.Debuting in the Silver Age of Comic Books, the Absorbing Man has featured in over four decades of Marvel continuity and other Marvel-endorsed products such as animated television series, video games, and merchandise such as trading cards.
name: Absorbing Man

description: Ares is a fictional character, a deity in the Marvel Comics Universe based on the Greek god of the same name.
name: Ares

description: Joseph is a Marvel Comics character who was briefly a member of the X-Men.
name: Joseph

description: The son of Reed Richards and Susan Storm of the Fantastic Four, Franklin may one day be the most powerful person on Earth. Right now, he's the son of a genius who finds adventure and fun around every corner.
name: Franklin Richards

description: Formerly known as Emil Blonsky, a spy of Soviet Yugoslavian origin working for the KGB, the Abomination gained his powers after receiving a dose of gamma radiation similar to that which transformed Bruce Banner into the incredible Hulk.
name: Abomination

description: Triton is a member of the Inhumans.
name: Triton

description: Mastermind (Jason Wyngarde) is a supervillain appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Mastermind (Jason Wyngarde)

description: The Mole Man is a fictional character, a comic book supervillain that exists in Marvel Universe.
name: Mole Man

description: Roderick Kingsley is the first of several fictional characters who would claim the alias Hobgoblin that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Hobgoblin (Roderick Kingsley)

description: Annihilus is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Annihilus

aliases: The Dread One; Lord of Chaos; The Great Enigma; Master of the Mindless Ones
description: Dormammu is a fictional character, a powerful mystical being that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Dormammu

description: Virginia "Pepper" Potts is a fictional supporting character and romantic love interest appearing in books published by Marvel Comics, in particular those featuring Iron Man.
name: Pepper Potts

description: The Titanium Man ("Chelovek-Titan") is the name of two fictional supervillains in the Marvel Comics universe.
name: Titanium Man

description: Blastaar, sometimes called the Living Bomb-Burst and Blasstaar, is a Marvel Comics supervillain.
name: Blastaar

description: The Crimson Dynamo (Russian:  , Bagrovyj Dinamo; also   (Krasn Dinamo) ) is the name of several fictional characters in the Marvel Comics Universe, most of whom have been supervillains.
name: Crimson Dynamo

description: Rhino is a fictional supervillain that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Rhino

description: Klaw (Ulysses Klaw) is a fictional character, a supervillain that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Klaw

description: The Leader (Samuel Sterns) is a fictional supervillain that appears in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Leader

description: Nightmare is a fictional character, a supervillain who appears in Marvel Comics, most commonly as one of Doctor Strange and Ghost Rider's major enemies.
name: Nightmare

description: Dragon Man is a fictional character, a former supervillain in the Marvel Comics Universe.
name: Dragon Man

description: The Puppet Master (real name Phillip Masters) is a fictional character, a supervillain that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.The Puppet Master uses radioactive clay to make puppets of people that he can then control, attaching them to strings and moving them as puppets; presumably he has some sort of psionic ability that enables him to do this.
name: Puppet Master

description: Andreas reappeared as the Swordsman in the latest incarnation of the Thunderbolts, though his true identity was kept secret for some time.
name: Swordsman

description: Timothy Aloysius Cadwallader "Dum Dum" Dugan is a fictional character in the Marvel Comics Universe.
name: Dum Dum Dugan

description: Kraven the Hunter is a fictional supervillain who appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Kraven the Hunter

description: The High Evolutionary is a fictional character that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: High Evolutionary

description: Lockjaw is a fictional bulldog-like being appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Lockjaw

description: Herman Schultz is a career criminal who, after several prison terms for robbery, built a battle suit that sent out shock waves to quickly open safes as well as give him a significant advantage over the New York police.
name: Shocker

description: British-born Mortimer Toynbee, abandoned by his parents so early in childhood that he cannot remember them, was placed in an orphanage where the other children, who regarded him as a freak due to his ugliness, his unusual physique and his leaping ability, continually tormented him.
name: Toad

description: Baron Wolfgang von Strucker is a fictional supervillain appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.Baron Strucker, a former Nazi officer, is one of the leaders of Hydra and an enemy of S.H.I.E.L.D., the Avengers, and the interests of the United States of America and of the free world in general.
name: Baron Strucker

description: The Blonde Phantom (Louise Grant Mason) is a fictional masked crime fighter in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Blonde Phantom

description: The Chameleon is a fictional character that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Chameleon

description: Diablo (Esteban Corazn de Ablo) is a fictional character, a supervillain in the Marvel Comics universe who is an enemy of the Fantastic Four.
name: Diablo

description: One of Spider-Man's oldest enemies, Mac Gargan has recently abandoned his Scorpion suit and identity and bonded with the alien symbiote that had previously been hosted by Peter Parker and Eddie Brock, becoming the new Venom.
name: Venom (Mac Gargan)

description: Ulik was a Rock Troll from the realm known as Nornheim, located underground within the dimension of Asgard.
name: Ulik

description: The Jackal is a fictional supervillain that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Jackal

description: David Cannon was always a bully, so his mutant abilities naturally led him to a life of crime and petty thievery, until his constant defeat at the hands of the Hank Pym and the Wasp led him to create the Whirlwind identity.
name: Whirlwind

description: The Grey Gargoyle (Paul Pierre Duval) is a fictional character, a supervillain that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics, often as an enemy of Thor, Iron Man, or Captain America.
name: Grey Gargoyle

description: Radioactive Man is the name of two characters from Marvel Comics.
name: Radioactive Man

description: Boomerang (Frederick "Fred" Myers) is a fictional character, a supervillain appearing in the Marvel Comics Universe.
name: Boomerang

description: The Mad Thinker is a fictional supervillain in the Marvel Comics Universe.
name: Mad Thinker

description: Groot (also known as the Monarch of Planet X) is a fictional superhero that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Groot

description: The Prowler is a fictional character, a superhero that appears in comics published by Marvel Comics.
name: Prowler

description: Count Nefaria is a fictional character that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Count Nefaria

description: Batroc (Georges Batroc) is a fictional supervillain appearing in publications from Marvel Comics.
name: Batroc the Leaper

aliases: He Whose Limbs Shatter Mountains and Whose Back Scrapes the Sun
description: Fin Fang Foom is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Fin Fang Foom

description: Silvio Manfredi has been a career criminal for most of his life.
name: Silvermane

description: After the Fantastic Four stopped the Skrulls' attempted invasion of Earth, Skrull Emperor Dorrek invested vast resources into creating a superbeing of his own.
name: Super-Skrull

description: Dr. Bill Foster, also known as Black Goliath, the second Giant-Man and the fourth Goliath, is a fictional character, and a comic book superhero in the Marvel Comics universe.
name: Goliath (Bill Foster)

description: Realizing the criminal potential of his abilities, Umberto stole a flock of trained birds from a fellow performer to assist him in his new costumed criminal guise as the Scarecrow.
name: Scarecrow

description: The Super-Adaptoid was created by the organization known as A.I.M. using a piece of the Cosmic Cube.
name: Super-Adaptoid

description: Psycho-Man is a fictional character, a supervillain that appears in comic books published by Marvel Comics.
name: Psycho-Man

description: Nothing is known about the Vanisher's past before he embarked on a one-man crime wave of spectacular thefts using his power of self-teleportation.
name: Vanisher

description: Iron Lad (Nathaniel "Nate" Richards) is a fictional superhero appearing in books published by Marvel Comics, in particular Young Avengers, a team of which Iron Lad is a member.
name: Iron Lad

description: Madame Masque, real name Whitney Frost and also known as Masque, is a fictional character, a supervillain that has appeared in various comic book series published by Marvel Comics.
name: Madame Masque

description: The Red Ghost (Ivan Kragoff) and his Super-Apes (Mikhlo/, Igor/, and Peotr/) are a group of Marvel Comics supervillains, who started their career fighting the Fantastic Four, before confronting other Marvel heroes such as Iron Man and Spider-Man.
name: Red Ghost

description: Dirk Garthwaite, the son of a construction worker and abusive father and husband, grew up filled with resentment and anger toward his father, who abandoned the family, and quickly turned to crime, in which he used a crowbar as a reminder of his father, destroying each place he robbed.
name: Wrecker

description: Ben Reilly was the most genetically stable of the many clones of Spider-Man created by Professor Miles Warren, the Jackal.
name: Ben Reilly

description: The Enchantress is the common primary alias of two fictional characters, supervillains in the Marvel Comics universe.
name: Enchantress

description: The Purple Man (real name Dr. Zebediah Killgrave) is a fictional character, a Marvel Comics supervillain.
name: Purple Man

description: For the Marvel superhero, see Frog-Man.Frog-Man is the name of two fictional characters in Marvel Comics.
name: Frog-Man (Ani-Men)

description: Molten Man (Mark Raxton) is a fictional character, a supervillain in the Marvel Universe.
name: Molten Man

description: Dark Beast (Henry Philip McCoy), sometimes known as the Black Beast, is a Marvel Comics supervillain, an alternate reality evil version of the X-Mens Beast.
name: Dark Beast

description: Major Glenn Talbot was member of United States Air Force, United States Army and Hulkbusters.
name: Glenn Talbot

description: The Hate-Monger is the name of several different characters from Marvel Comics.
name: Hate-Monger

description: Milos Masaryk, a Soviet intelligence agent assigned as a security guard for Anton Vanko, a Soviet inventor who developed the Crimson Dynamo armor, was tasked by the Soviet government to retrieve Vanko after he defected to the United States.
name: Unicorn

description: War hero Simon Garth was turned into a zombie by his secretary, Layla, who was also a voodoo priestess, after being killed by his gardener, Gyps.

description: Doctor Druid, also known as Doctor Droom and Druid, is a fictional character, a supernatural monster-hunter in the Marvel Comics universe.Co-created by writer-editor Stan Lee and penciller Jack Kirby, he starred in his own continuing feature that debuted in Amazing Adventures #1 (June 1961), predating Lee & Kirby's milestone creation The Fantastic Four #1 (Nov. 1961).
name: Doctor Druid

description: Leap-Frog is the name of two Marvel Comics supervillains who use a frog suit containing electrical coils on the soles of each of the two flippers which allow the wearer to leap great distances up to 60 ft (18 m) high or 100 ft (30 m) long.
name: Leap-Frog

name: Red Raven
